pullrequest.title: minor performance improvements.  Change for loops to dot6() where allowed.  Reuse findex[index].

content.raw:
I was able to see a small performance improvement; we can discuss whether it's meaningful.

My test was was running the `sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world` unthrottled with 1000 iterations. I compute real-time factor with additional precision by running for a minute and dividing the total simulated time by the total wall time. With gazebo_1.8, the real-time factor was 0.2532; with perf4 it was 0.2602, a difference of 0.007, about 2.69% faster.

I'll try again on a more relevant task shortly.

My test was was running the sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world unthrottled with 1000 iterations. I compute real-time factor with additional precision by running for a minute and dividing the total simulated time by the total wall time. With gazebo_1.8, the real-time factor was 0.2532; with perf4 it was 0.2602, a difference of 0.007, about 2.69% faster.

I'll try again on a more relevant task shortly.
